text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the official Vietnamese press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-- The National Assembly adopted the Corporate Income Tax Law on Monday, which will come into effect on January 1, 1999.
-- Communist Party General Secretary Do Muoi instructed local agencies and enterprises in central Vietnam to respect the local leadership of the party.
-- A feasibility study for the $130-million East-West Highway linking Vietnam, Laos and Thailand has been completed, according to Ministry of Communications and Transport.
-- The Ministry of Planning and Investment said that foreign firect investment in Vietnam has amounted to $531.8 million since early this year.

-- Domestic journalists were informed at a news conference about a government review of the socio-economic situation since the start of this year and measures to settle pending issues, especially in the last two months of the second quarter.
-- Communist Party General Secretary Do Muoi, President Le Duc Anh and other leaders met on Monday to celebrate the 22nd annivesary of the April 30 Liberation Day and the May 1 Labour Day.
-- The Ministry of Trade opened a seminar on "Vietnam in the process to join the World Trade Organisation (WTO)" to help Vietnamese enterprises understand the nature, principles and rules of the WTO.
-- Politburo member Truong Tan Sang called on party members to implement strictly regulations which state that party members should not be involved in private business.
